newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Anscor unit reports surge in 1996 earnings.
newsitem.headline: Anscor unit reports surge in 1996 earnings.

text.p: Unlisted Phelps Dodge Philippines Inc, a copper wire and cable manufacturer, reported on Thursday its after-tax profit in 1996 jumped to 173.4 million pesos from 31.6 million pesos in 1995.
Phelps Dodge is 59 percent-owned by A. Soriano Corp (Anscor) and 40 percent by Phelps Dodge Corp of the U.S.
Net sales in 1996, however, was lower at 2.18 billion pesos from 2.58 billion pesos in 1995, documents submitted to the Securities and Exchange Commission said.
An official of the Anscor group said the lower sales in 1996 was due to a realignment in product mix to focus on high-margin products such as building wires and telecommunication wires and cables.
But net income surged last year with the lowering of the import duty to three percent from 20 percent on copper rods, a raw material in making copper wires, the official said.
